author: R√©daction
title: US Open (H) : Carlos Alcaraz dispara√Æt d√®s le 2e tour de l'US Open, √©limin√© par Botic Van De Zandschulp
text:
Il √©tait 23h37 sous le toit du court Arthur-Ashe, et la m√™me heure quand le ciel est tomb√© sur la t√™te de Carlos Alcaraz. L'Espagnol, oppos√© au N√©erlandais Botic Van Den Zandschulp, qui a r√©alis√© le match de sa vie ou presque, a sembl√© inoffensif toute la rencontre, une raret√©. Et il s'est inclin√© en trois manches (6-1, 7-5, 6-4 en 2h19), jeudi soir.
L'√âQUIPE Le vainqueur du tournoi en 2022, 3e mondial, s'est fait rapidement subtiliser sa mise en jeu et s'est fait pi√©tiner par un N√©erlandais en feu. S'il a d√©break√© alors que son adversaire servait pour mener 3-1, semblant se r√©volter, le Murcien a conc√©d√© son service √† 5-5 puis s'est retrouv√© men√© deux manches √† rien, ne r√©sistant pas √† la puissance du 74e mondial, qui avait r√©ponse √† tout.
Une tourn√©e am√©ricaine rat√©e Jouant avec le public pour initier une r√©volte, toujours combatif malgr√© un bandage √† la cuisse gauche, Alcaraz a fini par c√©der 6-4 dans le troisi√®me set, sur un √©ni√®me service gagnant de Van de Zandschulp.
60 % Le nombre de points gagn√©s par Carlos Alcaraz derri√®re sa premi√®re balle. En comparaison, Botic Van De Zandschulp en a remport√© 78 %. Alcaraz, absent √† Montr√©al et √©limin√© d'entr√©e √† Cincinnati par Ga√´l Monfils , conclut la tourn√©e am√©ricaine avec un sentiment de tr√®s grande d√©ception, lui le vainqueur de l'US Open 2022. Le tableau s'ouvre pour Jannik Sinner et les autres pr√©tendants.
lire aussi Le tableau de l'US Open Botic Van De Zandschulp Carlos Alcaraz 311 commentaires 43 r√©actions ajouter un commentaire r√©agir √† l'article Les commentaires sont soumis √† des r√®gles de mod√©ration. lire la charte ce qu'en disent nos lecteurs i Carlos Alcaraz a suscit√© des r√©actions contrast√©es apr√®s son √©limination √† l'US Open, certains soulignant sa fatigue apr√®s une ann√©e charg√©e de succ√®s, tandis que d'autres pointent du doigt une possible d√©compression mentale. La performance de Botic Van De Zandschulp a √©galement √©t√© salu√©e pour son jeu solide et intelligent. lire la suite M Mohaka Bon pour Carlos c est clairement une √©norme d√©ception, ceci dit 21 ans, 4 GC dont 2 cette ann√©e, il a fait son ann√©e. Il est cuit mentalement, l encha√Ænement avec les JO c est un peu trop, on va le retrouver dans qq mois, apr√®s du repos, en grande forme j‚Äôen suis s√ªr ! 172 r√©agir signaler 7h afficher 310 autres commentaires L'√âQUIPE chrono filtrer : tennis 13:00

author: TIMESOFINDIA.COM
title: New Year's Eve dinner ideas to ring in 2024 in tasteful style - Times of India
text: As the clock ticks down to midnight on December 31st, the best way to welcome the New Year is to indulge in the tasteful treats. Whether you're hosting an intimate gathering with close friends or planning a lavish soir√©e, choosing the perfect menu can set the tone for a festive evening filled with joy, laughter, and culinary delights. In this article, we'll explore a variety of New Year's Eve dinner ideas to help you create a memorable dining experience that will leave your guests impressed and eager for the year ahead. From starters, soups, and main course to dinner, the list includes everything that will satiate all types of taste buds. Scroll down to learn the details. StartersKick off your New Year's Eve celebration with a selection of flavourful appetizers that will satiate your guests' taste buds and set the stage for the evening ahead. Tandoori Chicken: It is a popular Indian snack made with chicken pieces marinated in curd and a blend of spices that are further cooked in a tandoor, a cylindrical clay oven. This dish is characterized by its smoky, spicy, and tangy flavor profile. 106359714Saut√©ed Mushroom: A pan-fried dish made with chopped mushrooms, cooked in olive oil, along with fresh herbs, onions, and capsicum.Also Read: 10 party recipes for New Year‚Äôs night Hariyali kebab: A melt-in-the-mouth treat made with a mixture of vegetables that are blanched, minced, and mashed to make mini discs that are pan-fried to perfection. Soups Warm pureed treats seasoned with fresh herbs and spices and served with munchies. Creamy Tomato Soup: A warm and soulful soup made with tomato puree, cooked in oil along with ginger, garlic, butter, salt, pepper, and cream. It is best served with bread sticks or croutons. 106359716 Chicken Soup: A simple and healthy soup made with shredded chicken cooked in chicken stock along with sauces, salt, pepper, and ground spices.Also Read: 10 Best New Year's eve foods to celebrate 2023 Main CourseA good blend of filling and tasty preparations that go well with all types of bread. Vegetarian Risotto: Creamy Arborio rice cooked with seasonal vegetables, Parmesan cheese, and a splash of white wine, garnished with fresh herbs and microgreens for a flavorful and satisfying vegetarian option. Stuffed Mushrooms: Button mushrooms filled with a savory mixture of cream cheese, garlic, herbs, and breadcrumbs, baked until golden and bubbly. Chicken Biryani: A flavorful and layered treat made with basmati rice, marinated chicken, saffron water, and brown onions that is cooked on dum in a heavy-bottomed container. Dal Makhani: It's a creamy and indulgent lentil dish that combines black lentils and kidney beans, slow-cooked to perfection, and also uses butter and cream, which elevates the dish and pairs well with roti and rice. 106359717Butter Chicken: Butter Chicken is a luscious and creamy curry made with tender pieces of chicken simmered in a rich tomato-based gravy. The addition of butter and cream gives it a velvety texture and is a must-try. It can be paired with roti, naan, or rice. Butter Garlic Naan: It is made with refined flour, curd, yeast, butter, and lots of garlic. Aloo Naan: It is a leavened, oven-baked, or tawa-fried flatbread stuffed with boiled and mashed potatoes seasoned with spices. DessertsA tasteful selection of dishes for all those with a sweet tooth. Chocolate Fondue: A luscious chocolate fondue served with an assortment of dippers, including fresh fruits, marshmallows, and pound cake, for a fun and interactive dessert experience. Cr√®me Br√ªl√©e: Creamy vanilla custard topped with a caramelized sugar crust, offering a perfect balance of sweetness and sophistication. 106359718Gulab Jamun: A melt-in-the-mouth Indian dessert made with paneer, mawa, nuts, and sugar syrup.

author: TF1 INFO
title: Apr√®s le d√©luge dans la Ni√®vre, les habitants s'entraident pour √©vacuer l'eau des maisons
text: Les orages qui ont touch√© une majeure partie de la France cette semaine ont touch√© le d√©partement de la Ni√®vre.Certains habitants ont eu de l'eau jusqu'√† la taille, et de nombreuses maisons ont √©t√© inond√©es.L'une de nos √©quipes s'est rendue √† Narcy et Clamecy. Entrer dans sa maison est une √©preuve pour Pascal. √Ä l'int√©rieur, difficile de se frayer un chemin. Plus rien n'est √† sa place. Ce retrait√© trouve la force de nous montrer son jardin, devenu une piscine. [Trois voitures sont sous l'eau](/meteo/video-segre-en-anjou-bleu-meteo-france-vigilance-orange-departements-les-sols-sont-gorges-d-eau-du-maine-et-loire-a-la-nievre-les-images-des-spectaculaires-inondations-2305023.html), sa grange menace de s‚Äôeffondrer avec le courant. Les habitants s'entraident pour d√©gager l'eau Les 500 habitants de Narcy (Ni√®vre) n'ont pas dormi. Depuis l'aube, ils s'entraident pour d√©gager les maisons, pendant que les employ√©s municipaux s'activent pour rendre les routes praticables. Dans le caf√© de Fr√©d√©ric, on sort tout le mat√©riel pour commencer le nettoyage. L'eau est partie, la boue recouvre le sol. Tout a √©t√© inond√© en quelques minutes. Fabrice, le boulanger interrog√© dans la vid√©o en t√™te de cet article, a eu plus de chance. [La boutique a pris l'eau](/meteo/video-meteo-vigilance-alerte-intemperies-inondations-dans-l-indre-les-pompiers-a-pied-d-oeuvre-pour-aider-les-sinistres-2305125.html), mais pas l'atelier. Ce vendredi matin, il se remet d√©j√† √† faire du pain. Lire aussi "Les sols sont gorg√©s d'eau" : du Maine-et-Loire √† la Ni√®vre, les images des spectaculaires inondations Plus au nord de la Ni√®vre, √† Clamecy, un supermarch√© a √©t√© inond√© ce jeudi soir. Les clients ont √©t√© √©vacu√©s. Dehors, une femme peine √† tenir debout avec le courant. Les salari√©s nettoient depuis ce vendredi matin, il y a heureusement peu de d√©g√¢ts dans les rayons. Le commerce pourra rouvrir demain.

author: Muhammad Irfan
title: Ashrafi Urges Govt, Private Hajj Organizers To Prioritize Pilgrims Comfort - UrduPoint
text:
Muhammad Irfan Published June 01, 2024 | 10:16 PM
Pakistan Ulema Council (PUC) Chairman Hafiz Muhammad Tahir Mehmood Ashrafi on Saturday expressed his satisfaction with the ongoing Hajj operations and called upon government and private Hajj organizers to ensure the comfort and ease of pilgrims
ISLAMABAD, (UrduPoint / Pakistan Point News - 1st Jun, 2024) Pakistan Ulema Council (PUC) Chairman Hafiz Muhammad Tahir Mehmood Ashrafi on Saturday expressed his satisfaction with the ongoing Hajj operations and called upon government and private Hajj organizers to ensure the comfort and ease of pilgrims.
Talking to media , he emphasized the importance of maintaining high standards of service, particularly in ensuring the well-being of the intending pilgrims.
Ashrafi lauded the current Hajj operations, noting significant improvements in logistical arrangements, transportation, and accommodation for the pilgrims. He highlighted that the collaborative efforts between the Saudi and Pakistani authorities had resulted in a more organized and efficient Hajj experience this year.
"I am pleased with the way the Hajj operations have been conducted so far. The cooperation between the Pak-Saudi authorities has been exemplary, ensuring that our pilgrims can perform their religious duties with dignity and peace of mind," Ashrafi stated.
The PUC chairman also issued an advisory for pilgrims urging to book their Hajj packages through authorized organizers to avoid falling victim to fraudulent activities. He said the Saudi and Pakistani authorities, alongside the Hajj Organizers Association Pakistan (HAOP), had emphasized the necessity of legitimate booking to ensure a safe and genuine pilgrimage experience.
Ashrafi said to assist pilgrims in making legitimate arrangements, the Saudi Ministry of Hajj and Umrah, the Ministry of Religious Affairs and Interfaith Harmony, and HOAP had disseminated comprehensive guidelines from time to time.
He said these guidelines, frequently shared through a section of media , were designed to protect innocent pilgrims from the clutches of fraudsters.
Ashrafi advised the prospective pilgrims to verify the credentials of Hajj organizers, ensure that the organizers were officially recognized by the relevant Saudi and Pakistani authorities and follow the booking procedures as outlined in the official guidelines. By adhering to these recommendations, he said pilgrims could secure their journey and avoid any potential scams that could jeopardize their pilgrimage.
Ashrafi said the Dar-ul-Ifta of Saudi Arabia had issued a significant religious decree stating that performing Hajj without official permission was forbidden. ‚ÄúThis Fatwa aims to uphold the sanctity and order of the pilgrimage by ensuring that all pilgrims follow the proper channels and guidelines established by the Saudi authorities,‚Äù he added.
Ashrafi said pilgrims traveling from Islamabad and Karachi had expressed immense satisfaction with the " Road to Makkah " project. He said this initiative had significantly streamlined the travel process, making the spiritual journey to the holy land more efficient and comfortable.
Concluding his remarks, Ashrafi expressed deep appreciation for the Custodian of the Two Holy Mosques, King Salman bin Abdulaziz, and Crown Prince and Prime Minister Mohammad bin Salman for their unwavering commitment to providing comprehensive facilities and support to the 'Guests of Allah Almighty' through every possible means.

author: @sortirapariscom
title: Campelli, gastronomie du monde par le chef arm√©nien Vartivar Jarkezian
text:
Du haut de ses 27 ans, Vartivar Jarkezian a un parcours hors norme. N√© √† Beyrouth au Liban, ce chef d'origine arm√©nienne a fait ses armes durant dix ans en Arabie Saoudite avant de s'envoler pour Paris en 2015 o√π il est pass√© par le restaurant Bissac, non loin de l'Op√©ra, puis de gravir les √©chelons chez Shabour o√π il termine sous-chef.
En 2023, titill√© par une envie d'√™tre le chef de sa propre adresse, il reprend les r√™nes du restaurant Campelli, √† deux rues du Palais-Royal. Et c'est tout naturellement qu'il y dessine les contours d'une cuisine baign√©e de ses souvenirs d'enfance, revisitant des traditions culinaires en provenance de Beyrouth, bien s√ªr, mais aussi de Djeddah et d'Erevan.
Pour cr√©er ses plats construits autour de saveurs et d'√©pices orientales (zaatar, sumac, fleur d'oranger, rose), le chef use de techniques gastronomiques r√©solument contemporaines, mais en veillant √† garder toujours √† l'esprit ses racines, comme avec son plat phare, le chou-fleur de Flora, inspir√© par la recette de sa m√®re.
Pour la partie liquide de Campelli, Vartivar Jarkezian s'est entour√© de Claristin Christopher (pass√© par le Ritz Bar), √† la fois directeur de salle et mixologue. Si les cocktails et mocktails sont de la partie, le vin l'est tout autant avec pas moins de 85 r√©f√©rences de vins de France et du monde, notamment d'Arm√©nie, √† d√©couvrir √† travers des accords mets et vins en 5 verres (59‚Ç¨) et 7 verres (79‚Ç¨).
S'il est possible de piocher parmi les propositions √† la carte, la route de Campelli se parcourt aussi √† travers deux menus d√©couverte √† 89‚Ç¨ (en 5 services, test√© lors de notre passage) et 109‚Ç¨ (en 7 services). Bien qu'il ait commenc√© sous les meilleurs auspices, notre d√©jeuner s'est av√©r√© assez in√©gal, en particulier vers la toute fin.
Dans le d√©tail, on commence parfaitement, avec un trio d'amuse-bouches enchanteur : un g√¢teau de betterave au charbon v√©g√©tal, yaourt et vinaigre de framboise ; une tartelette menthe, estragon et piment arm√©nien ; un siphon d'olive verte, c√¢pres et une d√©licate plume de zaatar ; ainsi qu'un beurre de m√©lasse de dattes et huile d'olive de Tunisie √† tartiner sur un petit bain brioch√©, pour ne pas bouder notre plaisir.
Place ensuite au fameux chou-fleur de Flora (16‚Ç¨), un chou-fleur r√¥ti en plusieurs textures, assorti de tahini, s√©same, pesto de coriandre et sumac √† saucer tour √† tour ; aux d√©licates Saint-Jacques snack√©es et salade d'oseille orientale (25‚Ç¨) ; puis au manti du Caucase (27‚Ç¨), une raviole farcie de champignons - un peu fade, malgr√© les aromates alentours - accompagn√©e d'une salade de chou rouge - elle, trop saline.
La volaille fermi√®re au beurre blanc (31‚Ç¨) qui suit, pr√©sent√©e aux c√¥t√©s d'une carotte glac√©e topp√©e de raisins blancs, nous ram√®ne trop soudainement en France et semble bien p√¢lichonne compar√©s aux d√©couvertes pr√©c√©dentes, tandis que les desserts - un mhalabieh √† la fleur d'oranger (15‚Ç¨) trop pris et un trio de cr√®mes glac√©es aux saveurs originales et de petits biscuits au cacao (14‚Ç¨) - nous ont un peu laiss√©s sur notre faim.
Pour un d√©jeuner ou un diner plus intimiste, Campelli dispose d'une salle privatisable au sous-sol pouvant accueillir jusqu'√† 16 couverts.
Ce test a √©t√© r√©alis√© dans le cadre d‚Äôune invitation professionnelle. Si votre exp√©rience diff√®re de la n√¥tre, merci de le signaler dans les commentaires.
Lieu
Campelli
36 Rue Croix des Petits Champs
75001 Paris 1
Site officiel
campelli.paris

author: Matt Harmon
title: Draft Deep Dive: WRs part 1 + Ripple effects of Stefon Diggs trade to Texans [Video]
text: Subscribe to the Yahoo Fantasy Football Show Apple Podcasts | Spotify | YouTube Matt Harmon and Charles McDonald their 'Draft Deep Dive' series by taking a look at arguably the most loaded position in this year's draft: The wide receivers. Given how many notable prospects are in this class we decided to break the position series into two parts. Part one looks at most of the prospects that will likely go in the first two days of the draft. But before diving into this year's WR class the two react to one of the biggest WR moves of the offseason, as the Buffalo Bills traded Stefon Diggs to the Houston Texans in exchange for a 2024 2nd round pick. Harmon and McDonald look at the fantasy ripple effect for both teams as well as how this could impact the Bills decisions in this year's draft. Both believe the Bills could get aggressive early in the draft to try and land one of the top WR prospects. Speaking of those WR prospects, Harmon reveals the 8 guys he's studied the most heading into the draft. The two start by looking at the 'top 3' tier and if anything separates Marvin Harrison, Malik Nabers and Rome Odunze. Harmon and McDonald also attempt to identify which would be the best fits for each of the WRs. To end the show, Harmon and McDonald look at 5 other WR prospects that could go in the first round or be top end picks in the second round. Harmon also identifies his favorite day two sleeper at the WR . 3:45 - Ripple effect for both the Texans and Bills after Stefon Diggs trade 19:00 - Draft Deep Dive: Marvin Harrison Jr. 26:00 - Draft Deep Dive: Malik Nabers 32:00 - Draft Deep Dive: Rome Odunze 42:30 - Draft Deep Dive: Brian Thomas Jr. 49:15 - Draft Deep Dive: Ladd McConkey 55:00 - Draft Deep Dive: Keon Coleman 59:45 - Draft Deep Dive: Roman Wilson 1:03:10 - Draft Deep Dive: Rickey Pearsall üñ•Ô∏è Watch this full episode on YouTube Check out all the episodes of the Yahoo Fantasy Football Show and the rest of the Yahoo Sports podcast family at https://apple.co/3zEuTQj or at Yahoo Sports Podcasts
